reviews.review_msg: Second class with him and it was just as great as the first time. ;) Be sure to take ENG 102 with him in the fall.
Gorgeous and funny. Hard class.

Professor Everton is one of the best lecturers I have had the pleasure to encounter. He is funny, energetic and passionate about the material. He's approachable & friendly, with a great sense of humour. Each lecture is like reading a compelling essay - when it comes to writing his exams you KNOW everything because he has presented it so concisely.
Very engaging, connects the readings together. Great lecturer, but talks really fast - make sure to write fast.

A God among mere mortals. He's  a self-admitted hard marker but is absolutely WILLING to help you thru the writing process if you want/need. Helpful, articulate, engaging, funny, intelligent and PASSIONATE about what he's teaching. I will definitely take more of his classes in the future. I appreciate English much more now because of this man.

Dr. Everton is the best professor of english I have ever had.  His passion for literature is infectious!! He picks interesting texts and his lectures are engaging and informative.  He is charming and funny too! I will definitely take more classes with him.  I would HIGHLY recommend him as a prof!!

Great guy!  Very passionate and makes class interesting BUT a VERY hard maker!  This is my worst mark ever in three yrs at univeristy!  I have averaged an A- in my English courses up until now.  Final marks aren't in but based on my current marks with him I'm getting a C! :(

Initially, Everton comes off as scary and intimidating, but he is actually quite funny and a great lecturer.  Fair assignments and final exam.  I would recommend him, but be prepared to work hard and defend any comments or opinions you make in class.
This guy is demanding and can come off as intimitdating, but he's hilarious and very clear. I'd take a class with him again in a second.

Amazing. Had her for the first full online term and she was very considerate and easy to talk to. She gives amazing feedback and wants to see her students improve. She definitely made this online transition easier. 10/10 would recommend.
Michelle is awesome. She keeps the class engaged and always wants to help. One of the best courses and professors I have had.

I really enjoyed her teaching; she is really knowledgeable and genuinely wants you to do well in her class. The amount of reading is not unreasonable and the assignment outlines are comprehensive and helpful. She is a really great prof, who really loves the material she teaches. If you can, take a class with her.

She treats the students like they are in grade school and has all these juvenile group projects that you have to participate in.  She does not inspire particularly interesting discussion and I found this to be most boring class I have taken at SFU.
The best!!  Lets you pick what assmts to do and what weight to give them.  Fun and interesting; appreciates ppl's different strengths and weaknesses.  Highly recommended!
Excellent professor, extremely dedicated, organized, approchable and flexible. Keeps the student's best interst in mind.
Unique marking system, keeps students' best interests in mind, very friendly and relates to students well.  Classes were varied and fairly organized.  One of the better profs I've had.

Dr. Colligan is very passionate about her class. She makes the classroom environment very friendly and open to questions. She responds to emails quickly and gives fantastic feedback. I would definitely take another class with her.

Collette created a fun, informal environment conducive to learning. She made an unfamiliar and seemingly boring time period's literature come alive. The best English prof I've had so far, she even had a whole lecture devoted to prepping for the final.

This class was an insult to my intelligence.  Colligan seems to think it wonderfully clever and subversive to, instead of posting difficult texts to be analyzed, give us banal 19th century pop culture**** (magazine advertisements for cocoa, anyone?).  Skip it if you ACTUALLY WANT TO THINK.

Rather neutral on this one--probably won't take a course with him again though.  His final was entirely and only on material from lecture--no other answers/interpretations were allowed.  The novel was dull (NOTHING HAPPENED!), and lectures were entertaining, but confusing.  But if you attend the lectures, you get an extra letter grade on the final.

engaging entertainer, but not a particularly skilled lecturer. Flawed usage of rhetoric; anyone who has done cursory readings on the issues he uses to support arguments will note arguments are illogical/based on fallacies; Contrary viewpoints shouted down/ignored. Entertaining, but suitable for 1st/2nd year courses only. Avoid 3rd/4th year courses.
She's a great prof. encourages free thinking and interpretation rather than telling you what to think. She's really nice, lectures were fun and content was really interesting.

Diana is more of a shock-trooper of political correctness than a student of literary art. Don't take her classes unless you don't care about exploring how aesthetically strong literature actually works, or if you read with the mindset of an over-sensitive leftist. She is competent in other respects but TOO POLITICAL.

Kandice is one of my favourite profs I have had at SFU. She is very kind and definitely cares about her students and wants everyone to do well. She is very knowledgeable on the material she gives you which helps a lot for writing papers and exams. Her lectures are engaging and inspiring, and I hope to take another course with her in the future!

Lectures are boring and the slides are very scattered. Linley struggles to keep on topic and to use lecture time to address significance of the works we read. She spends a lot of unnecessary time going over author biographies and wastes class time.

An excellent teacher with an incredible level of knowledge on the subject of Romantic and Victorian literature. Only complaint is the breadth exceeds what can be retained. If you're looking for a prof that takes their subject and your comprehension and critical appraisal of it seriously, look no further. Excellent prof.
